content.rendered:
It’s week five of This Week in Genesis and this week you all went big on some great looking new Genesis based websites in the showcase. Plus, another theme from a guy called Calvin.

Themes

I swear I include a theme from this guy every week, but that’s no bad thing. Calvin Makes is back with Minny Plus and it looks pretty sweet.

Minny+ is a beautifully simple Genesis child theme, for a very simple price — http://t.co/RqdLTtqkBz #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@calvinmakes) May 19, 2015

Showcase

It seems like a lot of you were busy launching pretty websites this week. Here are a few of the best (free marketing hint: see how much more awesome it looks if you include an image in the tweet too 😉 ):

Happy to announce the redesign for @DifferKinder is live!! Happy launch day! http://t.co/JNr1V6ecsv #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/j3YRhnL2Ep

— Thauna (@BellanoStudio) May 20, 2015

Awesome #genesiswp site for local landscaping company http://t.co/SFpo43M6bO, Want a site like this? Get in touch.

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) May 21, 2015

Check out this "Epik" design by @WierApril – http://t.co/ic86s9oc82 #genesiswp

— appfinite (@appfinite) May 20, 2015

Latest project just launched! http://t.co/B0V4IztJXK @WinningAgent @idxbroker #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/L45O930C84

— Jackie D'Elia (@SavvyJackie) May 20, 2015

Just finished the redesign of http://t.co/gljucOIeld, our church's website. WordPress, #genesiswp, and Community Pro. pic.twitter.com/0dohCIqWWD

— John Sundberg (@BHWebWorks) May 20, 2015

New #genesiswp site launch for Sydney Marriage Celebrant http://t.co/PKjIJtydw6

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) May 20, 2015

Plugins

Bradley Potter not only makes lots of sweet Genesis plugins, he’s also got his nose very much to the ground on all the other Genesis plugins that are happening.

And his latest latest recommendation is Genesis Super Customizer by Mario Giancini, a new Genesis plugin which lets you customise your theme’s design right from the WordPress Customiser screen.

Check out the #genesiswp Super Customizer plugin by @MarioGiancini https://t.co/bxaWFRgI4a

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) May 15, 2015

Podcasts

Regular service was resumed in Genesis podcast land this week. That’s right, both OfficeHours.fm and the UK Genesis Podcast put out some awesome stuff for you this week.

In episode 8 of the UK Genesis podcast, Ben and Gary spoke with Clive Walker who gave a refreshingly honest overview of how he runs his web development business.

While in episode 59 of OfficeHours.fm, Carrie spoke to Naomi Bush about the fine and important art of payment processing and form. Useful lessons for anyone that deals with taking money as part of a web project.

Tutorials

If you do a lot of dev work sooner or later you’ll end up creating an FAQ section for a client. Fortunately, Sridhar has a nice solution for this (membership required):

FAQ section in Genesis using ACF Pro’s Repeater Field and jQuery Collapse https://t.co/ypTJRs0cLY

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) May 21, 2015

That’s it for this week and remember, if you want even more WordPress and Genesis news be sure to check out the Daily Bolt by Andrea Whitmer.

PS If you like keeping track of new Genesis theme releases I’ve started listing some of the best Genesis theme releases as they happen right here at genesiswp.guide/themes. Check it out and let me know what you think.

PPS Did you know you can win three, yes three, awesome Genesis themes and all you have to do is put your email address in the box at the end of this page? That’s right you can win three amazing Genesis themes by Ryan Townley, but you’ve only got till Monday. DO IT.

excerpt.rendered: Week five of This Week in Genesis sees some amazing designs and theme customisations in the showcase. You talented people.
